newsitem.title: GERMANY: European link needed to beat benefit fraud - Germany.
newsitem.headline: European link needed to beat benefit fraud - Germany.

text.p: European labour authorities ought to find new ways to work together to prevent benefits claims fraud, Bernhard Jagoda, head of the German labour office, said on Tuesday evening.

Talking about general fraud on unemployment benefit claims -- particularly in a case where an unemployed person who finds a job "forgets" to tell the authorities -- Jagoda said his office had taken action to track down such cases in Germany.
But he said the office ran up against problems in cross-border cases. "We need new instruments and a better cooperation between European authorities," he said.

He added that if a worker moved to, for example, the former Yugoslavia and found work, but remained in the German benefits system, it was very difficult to get information which proved that the benefit claim was fraudulent.
